newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin may seek foreign aid to pay wage debt-Tass.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin may seek foreign aid to pay wage debt-Tass.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin said on Friday Russia may seek foreign assistance to pay wage arrears to public sector workers, such as teachers and doctors, within three months, Itar-Tass news agency said.

Tass quoted Yeltsin as saying at a meeting with Russian regional leaders that external, as well as domestic sources, would be needed to pay the huge arrears on time. "Let's turn to leaders of foreign countries," he added.

Tass said First Deputy Prime Minister Anatoly Chubais, who was also present at the meeting in the Kremlin with regional leaders, had expressed doubts that it would be possible to pay the wage debts to all regions in such a short time.

Yeltsin responded by saying the governemnt had recently managed to pay off pension arrears rapidly and that it was necessary now to "continue pursuing this line and under no circumstances permit any delays or let the debt accumulate."
He gave no more details of how Russia might try to raise the money.

Tass did not say how much public sector workers were owed. But wage arrears just to the armed forces, which Yeltsin has said must be paid in the next two months, total about five trillion roubles ($860 million).
